titleStmt.title: Edward R. S. Canby to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1562

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Correspondence, 1863-1867

body.p:
War Department
Washington City,
January 26th 1865.
Sir:

The petition for the release of Reuben Reasor, George Goodwin and George Whitecotton, stated to be prisoners of war at Camp Douglas, Illinois, has been submitted to the Secretary of War, by whom I am instructed to say that their release can not be granted, at this time, but that their cases will be held in reserve, and that they will not be sent South for exchange against their consent.

Very Respectfully,
Your Obedient Servant,
Ed. R, S, Canby
Brig. Genl. A. A. G.

His Excellency Thos. E. Bramlette,
Governor of Kentucky,
Frankfort,
Kentucky.
